{"step_by_step_thinking": "The paranasal sinuses are air-filled spaces within the bones of the skull that are connected to the nasal cavity. They develop during fetal development and continue to grow and develop throughout childhood. The first paranasal sinus to develop is the ethmoidal sinus. The ethmoidal sinus is located between the eyes and is divided into anterior and posterior ethmoidal sinuses. The maxillary sinus, frontal sinus, and sphenoidal sinus develop later in fetal development and childhood. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Ethmoidal.", "answer_choice": "B"}
